STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 10, 2023
Matthew Yohe
BARAGA/HOUGHTON/KEWEENAW COUNTY DHHS
108 MAIN ST,
BARAGA, MI, 49908-9671
Re: License #: CP070200958
Dear Mr. Yohe:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
July 6, 2023. Due to the violation of an applicable licensing rule, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, Area Manager, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
Case Plan development, reassessment. Updated
Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days before the
case plan due date.
The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to
capture family demographics, FTM logistical information,
needs, strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the
safety plan, and any recommendations made for the
family during the FTM. The DHS-1105, Family Team
Meeting Report, must be completed for every FTM.
Three files and elevan FTMs were reviewed. Three of elevan FTMs did not have the
DHS-1105 uploaded. The FTMs were completed however the DHS-1105 was not in
the MICSAWIS system.
One of elevan FTM’s reviewed was complted late, after the USP was due. The USP
was due October 19, 2022 and the FTM was completed November 1, 2023.
VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Technical assistance was not required at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency completed a corrective action plan in response to the violations
established during the renewal audit completed July 8, 2022. The agency CAP
was sucessful in preventing repeat violations as none were etablished during the
current interim inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was reviewed and found to be
thorough. The report stated that staff turnover continues to be a challenge. The
report also spoke to the agency’s efforts to adhere to their CAP and success in
doing so.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office therefore financial records were not reviewed.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported feeling very supported by their supervisor and the agency
administration. Staff also reported that they feel they are part of a supportive team.
Youth were not interviewed by the consultant.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The DHHS office is modern, well organized, spacious, and well equipped.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst generated three safety alerts when she visited the foster homes.
They are as follows.
Safety Alert #1. The safety alert was generated on March 23, 2023, and involved a
fire alarm that was not installed in the basement. A fire alarm was not installed as a
corrective measure as the foster home was closing their foster home. Verification of
the closing action was in CWLM.
Safety Alert #2. A safety alert was generated on March 22, 2023, as the foster
home was remodeling a bedroom bathroom. A gate to the bedroom preventing
foster children from entering the adult bedroom was installed as well as a child
safety knob on the bedroom door. Photos were provided of the installed gate and
safety knob.
Safety Alert #3. A safety alert was generated on March 23, 2023, as firearms were
not stored properly and a foster child bedroom did not have dry wall on the walls.
The agency ordered an approved gun cabinet and triggers lock cables were also
installed on the firearms. A photo of the trigger locked firearms was provided.
The foster child was moved to another room until drywall is installed.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
July 10, 2023
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
